details.title: Opinion item: cancelled US-military specifications

kwd: US Military Specification and Standard system

p: William A. Marsh is a Reliability and Quality Assurance Consultant with extensive experience in commercial, NASA, and DoD programs. His major client is the Space Station Biological Research Project managed by the NASA/Ames Research Center. He is an ASQ Certified Reliability Engineer and Certified Quality Engineer, an SME Certified Manufacturing Engineer, and is a Registered Professional Engineer in California.

details.abstract: The US Military Specification and Standard system has evolved over the years from simple documents to today's complex documents containing the collected knowledge of both the government and industry. Specifications define materials & processes, performance, quality assurance, and packaging of everything from nuts & bolts to weapons systems, and handkerchiefs to gunpowder. Standards identify preferred or acceptable materials, processes, and procedures. Handbooks contain compilations of data regarding particular subjects. The US Military Specification and Standards system was modified as part of the DoD Acquisition Reform program, resulting in cancellation of many of the specifications, standards, handbooks, and supporting documents.
